meanings.sent1: The rabbles gathered in the square, shouting and causing chaos.
meanings.sent2: The police had to disperse the rabbles that were blocking the street.
meanings.sent3: The rabbles at the concert were so loud, it was hard to hear the music.
meanings.sent4: The rabbles of shoppers swarmed the store during the Black Friday sale.
meanings.sent5: The rabbles of birds in the park created a cacophony of chirping and squawking.

meanings.definition: To speak in a rapid, confused, or meaningless way.
meanings.sent1: He rabbles on and on during his speeches, making it hard to follow his point.
meanings.sent2: She tends to rabbles when she gets nervous and can't find the right words.
meanings.sent3: The toddler started to rabbles about his imaginary friend, much to his parents' amusement.
meanings.sent4: The politician tried to rabbles his way out of answering the tough questions.
meanings.sent5: As the teacher asked a question, the students began to rabbles their answers all at once.
